result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christian G Malave

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant Christian G Malave not in court, in custody.  
Student Intern Caroline Pelligrini supervised by Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for Scheduling  Conference. Defense in receipt of a global offer and request a resolution date. 
Defense counsel to file plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing, 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Plea and Sentencing hearing scheduled November 18, 2022 at 2:00pm.

Defendant Christian G Malave in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Christian G Malave in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christian G Malave appeared by video means.
Case in court for a preliminary hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Christian G Malave in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Christian G Malave in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christian G Malave appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
